DataElement.preferredName: Monoclonal Gammopathy of Renal Significance Classification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the monoclonal gammopathy of renal significance classification.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Monoclonal Gammopathy of Renal Significance Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A condition caused by a B-cell or plasma cell clone resulting in the deposition of the secreted monoclonal immunoglobulin, without evidence for overt lymphoma or myeloma. This category includes a wide spectrum of renal pathology and include such lesions as immunoglobulin-associated amyloidosis, the monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition diseases (MIDDs; light chain deposition disease, heavy chain deposition disease, and light and heavy chain deposition disease), proliferative glomerulonephritis with monoclonal immunoglobulin deposits (PGNMID), C3 glomerulopathy with monoclonal gammopathy, light chain proximal tubulopathy (Fanconi syndrome), and several others._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition caused by a B-cell or plasma cell clone resulting in the deposition of the secreted monoclonal immunoglobulin, without evidence for overt lymphoma or myeloma. This category includes a wide spectrum of renal pathology and include such lesions as immunoglobulin-associated amyloidosis, the monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition diseases (MIDDs; light chain deposition disease, heavy chain deposition disease, and light and heavy chain deposition disease), proliferative glomerulonephritis with monoclonal immunoglobulin deposits (PGNMID), C3 glomerulopathy with monoclonal gammopathy, light chain proximal tubulopathy (Fanconi syndrome), and several others.

Concepts.definition: A condition caused by a B-cell or plasma cell clone resulting in the deposition of the secreted monoclonal immunoglobulin, without evidence for overt lymphoma or myeloma. This category includes a wide spectrum of renal pathology and include such lesions as immunoglobulin-associated amyloidosis, the monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition diseases (MIDDs; light chain deposition disease, heavy chain deposition disease, and light and heavy chain deposition disease), proliferative glomerulonephritis with monoclonal immunoglobulin deposits (PGNMID), C3 glomerulopathy with monoclonal gammopathy, light chain proximal tubulopathy (Fanconi syndrome), and several others.

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Monoclonal Gammopathy of Renal Significance Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition caused by a B-cell or plasma cell clone resulting in the deposition of the secreted monoclonal immunoglobulin, without evidence for overt lymphoma or myeloma. This category includes a wide spectrum of renal pathology and include such lesions as immunoglobulin-associated amyloidosis, the monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition diseases (MIDDs; light chain deposition disease, heavy chain deposition disease, and light and heavy chain deposition disease), proliferative glomerulonephritis with monoclonal immunoglobulin deposits (PGNMID), C3 glomerulopathy with monoclonal gammopathy, light chain proximal tubulopathy (Fanconi syndrome), and several others._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fanconi syndrome that is caused by light chain deposition resulting in a proximal tubulopathy.

Concepts.definition: Fanconi syndrome that is caused by light chain deposition resulting in a proximal tubulopathy.

PermissibleValues.value: Immunotactoid glomerulopathy (ITGN)/ Glomerulonephritis with organized monoclonal microtubular immunoglobulin deposits (GOMMID)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Glomerulonephritis characterized by the presence of Congo-red negative microfibrils in the mesangium and capillary walls of the glomeruli. Morphologic findings include formation of microtubules, evident on electron microscopy, that are larger than those seen in fibrillary glomerulonephritis (30-50 versus 16-24 nm in diameter). There may be some overlap in the size of fibrils found in both conditions.

Concepts.definition: Glomerulonephritis characterized by the presence of Congo-red negative microfibrils in the mesangium and capillary walls of the glomeruli. Morphologic findings include formation of microtubules, evident on electron microscopy, that are larger than those seen in fibrillary glomerulonephritis (30-50 versus 16-24 nm in diameter). There may be some overlap in the size of fibrils found in both conditions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Glomerulonephritis characterized by the presence of Congo-red negative microfibrils in the mesangium and capillary walls of the glomeruli. It is associated with marked proteinuria and leads to progressive renal failure.

Concepts.definition: Glomerulonephritis characterized by the presence of Congo-red negative microfibrils in the mesangium and capillary walls of the glomeruli. It is associated with marked proteinuria and leads to progressive renal failure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare lesion composed of histiocytes containing intra-lysosomal accumulation of immunoglobulin light chains. Crystal-storing histiocytosis is often associated with plasma cell dyscrasias and lymphoproliferative disorders.

Concepts.definition: A condition characterized by histiocytes containing intra-lysosomal accumulation of immunoglobulin light chains. Crystal-storing histiocytosis is often associated with plasma cell dyscrasias and lymphoproliferative disorders.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Light Chain Proximal Tubulopathy without Crystals

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Light Chain Proximal Tubulopathy without Crystals
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic variant of light chain proximal tubulopathy with no evidence of crystal formation. It is characterized by acute tubular injury with no evidence lysosomal immunoglobulin crystals.

Concepts.longName: Light Chain Proximal Tubulopathy without Crystals
Concepts.definition: A morphologic variant of light chain proximal tubulopathy with no evidence of crystal formation. It is characterized by acute tubular injury with no evidence lysosomal immunoglobulin crystals.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subset of C3 glomerulopathy in which there is an associated finding of monoclonal gammopathy.

Concepts.definition: A subset of C3 glomerulopathy in which there is an associated finding of monoclonal gammopathy.

PermissibleValues.value: Proliferative glomerulonephritis with monoclonal immunoglobulin G deposits (PGNMID)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Proliferative Glomerulonephritis with Monoclonal IgG Deposits

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Proliferative Glomerulonephritis with Monoclonal IgG Deposits
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sub-type of monoclonal gammopathy of renal significance, characterized by restriction to a single immunoglobulin G heavy chain subclass and a single light chain isotype. Light microscopy often shows an endocapillary proliferative or membranoproliferative glomerulopathy. Electron microscopy reveals electron-dense subendothelial and mesangial deposits.

Concepts.longName: Proliferative Glomerulonephritis with Monoclonal IgG Deposits
Concepts.definition: A sub-type of monoclonal gammopathy of renal significance, characterized by restriction to a single immunoglobulin G heavy chain subclass and a single light chain isotype. Light microscopy often shows an endocapillary proliferative or membranoproliferative glomerulopathy. Electron microscopy reveals electron-dense subendothelial and mesangial deposits.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A plasma cell neoplasm characterized by the deposition of immunoglobulin in tissues, resulting in impaired organ function. It includes the following entities: primary amyloidosis, heavy chain deposition disease, and light chain deposition disease.

Concepts.definition: A mature B-cell neoplasm characterized by the deposition of immunoglobulin in tissues, resulting in impaired organ function. It includes the following entities: primary amyloidosis, heavy chain deposition disease, and light chain deposition disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Glomerulonephritis caused by cryoglobulins which are composed of monoclonal immunoglobulins IgG, IgA, or IgM. It occurs in patients with lymphoproliferative disorders.

Concepts.definition: Glomerulonephritis caused by cryoglobulins which are composed of monoclonal immunoglobulins IgG, IgA, or IgM. It occurs in patients with lymphoproliferative disorders.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

This category includes a wide spectrum of renal pathology and include such lesions as immunoglobulin-associated amyloidosis, the monoclonal immunoglobulin deposition diseases (MIDDs; light chain deposition disease, heavy chain deposition disease, and light and heavy chain deposition disease), proliferative glomerulonephritis with monoclonal immunoglobulin deposits (PGNMID), C3 glomerulopathy with monoclonal gammopathy, light chain proximal tubulopathy (Fanconi syndrome), and several others.
